name: Communication
description: Across these episodes, “Communication” is treated as a core leadership and product skill: how you gather signal, create shared understanding, and drive decisions and action under ambiguity. The theme spans internal communication (feedback, alignment, meetings, decision-making) and external communication (positioning, sales narratives, brand storytelling), showing that clarity and context—not charisma—are what reduce friction and accelerate execution.
subtopics: How to ask better questions and gather high-signal input (who to ask, how to structure prompts, avoiding vague advice)
How leaders create alignment: turning strategy into a shared narrative, repeating it consistently, and translating it into decisions and priorities
Difficult conversations: delivering performance feedback, saying “no” (promotions/requests), and preserving trust while raising standards
Running meetings and disagreements well: separating discovery vs. decision, making assumptions explicit, and using structured dissent to surface blind spots
Communicating product value externally: positioning, sales pitches that prevent “no decision,” and brand narratives that differentiate
Using language and metaphors to convey product “taste,” UX intent, and the feel of an experience (especially in fast-changing/AI contexts)
common_frameworks: Curiosity Loops (systematic input gathering via structured questions and targeted advisors)
Strategic Narrative: “old game → new game” shift story used as a company-wide north star (movement-style messaging)
Positioning-to-Pitch translation (value-first sales narrative to reduce “no decision” and clarify differentiation vs. alternatives)
Meeting/decision hygiene: explicitly label discussion vs. discovery vs. decision; document assumptions and decision owners
Structured disagreement: pre-mortems, kill criteria, and making implicit assumptions explicit to improve decision quality
Disagree-and-commit (mechanism for moving forward after debate while maintaining alignment)
